attachments.title: Meteor Raises $20M To Build The One JavaScript Stack To Rule Them All
attachments.text: The competitive landscape for app development tool providers continues to become tighter, with Meteor Development Group raising $20 million for its stack of frameworks and tools for developing web and mobile applications in JavaScript.

text: Does meteor work well with ember <@U047GTU64>?
haha
I would guess the answer is "no"
my impression is that you either opt into the complete meteor stack or choose something else
very happy to be told I’m wrong though
they have there own hbs: <https://atmospherejs.com/meteor/spacebars>

text: all this churn just makes me do more with vanilla and microlibs :simple_smile:
nikoskatsikanis: the downside of that is when other developers come to work on your apps there will be some amount of extra overhead getting familiar
as opposed to a convention-driven framework where you pretty much know where everything will be
not saying it’s a cut-and-dry argument
there absolutely are projects that don’t warrant a framework
to support this argument, I’ve done ~60 remote pairing session on Ember apps
and it really is true
I was able to dive in, without knowing much in advance about any app
Good points!
